pages.text: The $(d)Item Filter$() has a list of up to 9 items, which can act as either a blacklist or a whitelist for certain things.$(br2)Use the Filter to open it, and place items in the slots to add them to the list.$(br2)The button on the far right of the gui lets you $(3)toggle between blacklist and whitelist mode$() for the entire Filter.
pages.title: Item Filter

pages.text: Above each filled slot is 2 buttons. The left button allows you to $(3)toggle if the slot is an Item Filter or a Tag Filter$().$(br2)The right button changes depending on the above. If the slot is an Item Filter, it allows you to $(3)toggle if it requires it to match the data components$().$(br2)If it's a Tag Filter, it allows you to $(3)cycle the tag$(). For example, putting in an Iron Ingot and setting it to be a Tag Filter, you can cycle between it being "Beacon Payments", "Ingots", "Trim Materials", etc.
